33   | /** ************************************************************************ **/

36   | 
37   | #include <stdio.h>
38   | #include <stdarg.h>
39   | #include <tcl.h>
40   | #include "config.h"
41   | 
42   | #ifdef HAVE_STDLIB_H
43   | #include <stdlib.h>
44   | #endif
45   | 
46   | #if STDC_HEADERS || HAVE_STRING_H
47   | #include <string.h>
48   | /**
49   |  **  An ANSI string.h and pre-ANSI memory.h might conflict.
50   |  **/
51   | #if !STDC_HEADERS && HAVE_MEMORY_H
52   | #include <memory.h>
53   | #endif /** not STDC_HEADERS and HAVE_MEMORY_H **/
54   | #else /** not STDC_HEADERS and not HAVE_STRING_H **/
55   | #include <strings.h>
56   | /**
57   |  **  memory.h and strings.h conflict on some systems.
58   |  **/
59   | #endif /** not STDC_HEADERS and not HAVE_STRING_H  **/
60   | 
61   | #ifdef HAVE_UNISTD_H
62   | #include <unistd.h>
63   | #include <sys/types.h>
64   | #endif
65   | 
66   | #ifdef HAVE_CTYPE_H
67   | #include <ctype.h>
68   | #endif
69   | 
70   | #ifdef HAVE_SYS_MODE_H
71   | /* #include <sys/mode.h> */
72   | #endif
73   | 
74   | #ifdef HAVE_SYS_STAT_H
75   | #include <sys/stat.h>
76   | #endif
77   | 
78   | #ifdef HAVE_SYS_TERMIOS_H
79   | #include <sys/termios.h>
80   | #else
81   | #ifdef HAVE_TERMIO_H
82   | #include <termio.h>
83   | #endif
84   | #endif
85   | 
86   | #ifdef HAVE_FCNTL_H
87   | #include <fcntl.h>
88   | #endif
89   | 
90   | #if !defined(TIOCGWINSZ) && defined(HAVE_SYS_IOCTL_H)
91   | #include <sys/ioctl.h>
92   | #endif
93   | 
94   | #if defined(DIRENT) || defined(_POSIX_VERSION)
95   | #include <dirent.h>
96   | #define NLENGTH(dirent) (strlen((dirent)->d_name))
97   | #else /** not (DIRENT or _POSIX_VERSION) **/
98   | #define dirent direct
99   | #define NLENGTH(dirent) ((dirent)->d_namlen)
100  | #ifdef SYSNDIR
101  | #include <sys/ndir.h>
102  | #endif /** SYSNDIR **/
103  | #ifdef SYSDIR
104  | #include <sys/dir.h>
105  | #endif /** SYSDIR **/
106  | #ifdef NDIR
107  | #include <ndir.h>
108  | #endif /** NDIR **/
109  | #endif /** not (DIRENT or _POSIX_VERSION) **/
110  | 
111  | #ifdef HAVE_ERRNO_H
112  | #include <errno.h>
113  | #else
114  | extern	int	  errno;
115  | #endif

118  | #  include <librko.h>

121  | /** ************************************************************************ **/

124  | 
125  | /**
126  |  **  Structure to store information about a file.  Includes its name
127  |  **  and the structure to store information from the stat system call.
128  |  **/
129  | 
130  | typedef struct _file_entry {
131  |     char*        fi_prefix;
132  |     char*        fi_name;
133  |     struct stat  fi_stats;
134  |     int          fi_listcount;
135  |     struct _file_entry* fi_subdir;
136  | } fi_ent;
137  | 
138  | /**
139  |  **  Error handling
140  |  **/
141  | 
142  | typedef	enum	{
143  | 	NO_ERR = 0,			/** No error			     **/
144  | 	NO_ERR_DEBUG,			/** Debugging			     **/
145  | 	NO_ERR_START,			/** Start logging		     **/
146  | 	NO_ERR_END,			/** End logging			     **/
147  | 	NO_ERR_VERBOSE,			/** Verbose messages		     **/
148  | 	ERR_PARAM = 10,			/** Parameter error		     **/
149  | 	ERR_USAGE,			/** Usage information		     **/
150  | 	ERR_ARGSTOLONG,			/** Arguments to long		     **/
151  | 	ERR_OPT_AMBIG = 40,		/** Option is ambiguous		     **/
152  | 	ERR_OPT_NOARG,			/** Option allows no argument	     **/
153  | 	ERR_OPT_REQARG,			/** Option requires an argument	     **/
154  | 	ERR_OPT_UNKNOWN,		/** Unrecognized option 	     **/
155  | 	ERR_OPT_ILL,			/** Illegal option 		     **/
156  | 	ERR_OPT_INV,			/** Invalid option 		     **/
157  | 	ERR_USERLVL,			/** Unknown userlevel		     **/
158  | 	ERR_GETOPT,			/** getopt() failed		     **/
159  | 	ERR_OPEN = 50,			/** Error opening file		     **/
160  | 	ERR_POPEN,			/** Error opening pipe	    	     **/
161  | 	ERR_OPENDIR,			/** Error opening directory	     **/
162  | 	ERR_CLOSE,			/** Error when closing a file	     **/
163  | 	ERR_PCLOSE,			/** Error when closing a pipe	     **/
164  | 	ERR_CLOSEDIR,			/** Error when closing a directory   **/
165  | 	ERR_READ,			/** Error when reading from a file   **/
166  | 	ERR_READDIR,			/** Error when reading directory     **/
167  | 	ERR_WRITE,			/** Error when writing to a file     **/
168  | 	ERR_SEEK,			/** Seek error			     **/
169  | 	ERR_FLUSH,			/** Flush error			     **/
170  | 	ERR_DUP,			/** File duplication error	     **/
171  | 	ERR_DIRNAME,			/** Cannot build directory name	     **/
172  | 	ERR_NAMETOLONG,			/** Directory name to long	     **/
173  | 	ERR_DIRNOTFOUND,		/** Directory not found		     **/
174  | 	ERR_FILEINDIR,			/** File not in directory	     **/
175  | 	ERR_NODIR,			/** Not a directory		     **/
176  | 	ERR_UNLINK,			/** Cannot unlink file		     **/
177  | 	ERR_RENAME,			/** Cannot rename file		     **/
178  | 	ERR_ALLOC = 70,			/** Out of memory		     **/
179  | 	ERR_SOURCE,			/** Error while sourcing ...	     **/
180  | 	ERR_UNAME,			/** Uname failed		     **/
181  | 	ERR_GETHOSTNAME,		/** gethostname failed		     **/
182  | 	ERR_GETDOMAINNAME,		/** getdomainname failed	     **/
183  | 	ERR_STRING,			/** string error		     **/
184  | 	ERR_DISPLAY = 90,		/** cannot open display	    	     **/
185  | 	ERR_IN_MODULEFILE = 100,	/** modulefile related errors	     **/
186  | 	ERR_PARSE,			/** Parse error (modulefile)	     **/
187  | 	ERR_EXEC,			/** Execution error (modulefile)     **/
188  | 	ERR_EXTRACT,			/** Cannot extract X11 ressources    **/
189  | 	ERR_COMMAND,			/** Unrecognized command	     **/
190  | 	ERR_LOCATE,			/** Module file not found	     **/
191  | 	ERR_MAGIC,			/** Bad magic number		     **/
192  | 	ERR_MODULE_PATH,		/** Module path not set		     **/
193  | 	ERR_HOME,			/** Home not set		     **/
194  | 	ERR_SHELL,			/** Unknown shell type		     **/
195  | 	ERR_DERELICT,			/** Unknown shell derelict	     **/
196  | 	ERR_CONFLICT = 150,		/** Module file conflicts	     **/
197  | 	ERR_PREREQ,			/** Module file prerequirements	     **/
198  | 	ERR_NOTLOADED,			/** Module file is currently not l.  **/
199  | 	ERR_DUP_SYMVERS,		/** Duplicate symbolic version	     **/
200  | 	ERR_SYMLOOP,			/** Loop in symbol version def.	     **/
201  | 	ERR_BADMODNAM,			/** Bad modulename in version, alias **/
202  | 	ERR_DUP_ALIAS,			/** Duplicate alias		     **/
203  | 	ERR_CACHE_INVAL,		/** Invalid cache version	     **/
204  | 	ERR_CACHE_LOAD,			/** Cannot load cache properly	     **/
205  | 	ERR_BEGINENV,			/** No update if no .modulesbeginenv **/
206  | 	ERR_BEGINENVX,			/** No MODULESBEGINENV env.var.      **/
207  | 	ERR_INIT_TCL,			/** Cannot initialize TCL	     **/
208  | 	ERR_INIT_TCLX,			/** Cannot initialize extended TCL   **/
209  | 	ERR_INIT_ALPATH,		/** Cannot set up autoload path      **/
210  | 	ERR_INIT_STUP,			/** No 'module load in the shellstups**/
211  | 	ERR_SET_VAR,			/** Cannot set TCL variable	     **/
212  | 	ERR_INFO_DESCR,			/** Unrecognized module info descr.  **/
213  | 	ERR_INVWGHT_WARN,		/** Invalid error weight	     **/
214  | 	ERR_INVFAC_WARN,		/** Invalid error facility	     **/
215  | 	ERR_COLON,			/** Colon in tracing pattern	     **/
216  | 	ERR_INTERNAL = 990,		/** Error logger internal error	     **/
217  | 	ERR_INTERAL,			/** Alias module internal error	     **/
218  | 	ERR_INTERRL,			/** Error logger internal error	     **/
219  | 	ERR_INVAL,			/** Invalid parameter to the error   **/
220  | 	ERR_INVWGHT,			/** logger			     **/
221  | 	ERR_INVFAC,			/** Invalid error facility	     **/
222  |         ERR_ENVVAR,                     /** environment variables are inconsistent **/ 
223  | } ErrType;
224  | 
225  | /**
226  |  **  Error return values. Only OK, PROBLEM and ERROR will be returned to the
227  |  **  caller, In case of the remaining, the error handler takes control over the
228  |  **  whole application.
229  |  **/
230  | 
231  | typedef	enum	{
232  | 	OK = 0,				/** Everything's up and running	     **/
233  | 	WARN = 2,			/** A warning (mapped to OK by the   **/
234  | 					/** Errorlogger			     **/
235  | 	PROBLEM = 5,			/** Problem ... program might cont.  **/
236  | 	ERROR = 7,			/** Error .. try gracefull aborting  **/
237  | 	FATAL = 10,			/** The following will lead to the   **/
238  | 	PANIC = 20			/** progrm being aborted by the er-  **/
239  | 					/** ror logger immediatelly	     **/
240  | } ErrCode;
241  |

261  | #define	WITHOUT_DEBUGGING		!defined( WITH_DEBUG_INFO)
262  | #define	WITH_DEBUGGING			defined( WITH_DEBUG_INFO)
263  | #define	WITH_DEBUGGING_MODULECMD	(WITH_DEBUGGING && WITH_DEBUG_INFO > 0)
264  | #define	WITH_DEBUGGING_MODULECMD_1	(WITH_DEBUGGING && WITH_DEBUG_INFO > 1)
265  | #define	WITH_DEBUGGING_INIT		(WITH_DEBUGGING && WITH_DEBUG_INFO > 10)
266  | #define	WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK		(WITH_DEBUGGING && WITH_DEBUG_INFO > 20)
267  | #define	WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK_1	(WITH_DEBUGGING && WITH_DEBUG_INFO > 21)
268  | #define	WITH_DEBUGGING_LOCATE		(WITH_DEBUGGING && WITH_DEBUG_INFO > 30)
269  | #define	WITH_DEBUGGING_LOCATE_1		(WITH_DEBUGGING && WITH_DEBUG_INFO > 31)
270  | #define	WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL		(WITH_DEBUGGING && WITH_DEBUG_INFO > 40)
271  | #define	WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_1		(WITH_DEBUGGING && WITH_DEBUG_INFO > 41)
272  | #define	WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_2		(WITH_DEBUGGING && WITH_DEBUG_INFO > 42)
273  | #define	WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_3		(WITH_DEBUGGING && WITH_DEBUG_INFO > 43)
274  | 
275  | /**
276  |  **  Default error log facilities
277  |  **/
278  | 
279  | #ifdef	WITH_LOG_FACILITY_VERBOSE
280  | #   define	DEF_FACILITY_VERBOSE		WITH_LOG_FACILITY_VERBOSE
281  | #else
282  | #   define	DEF_FACILITY_VERBOSE		_stderr
283  | #endif
284  | 
285  | #ifdef	WITH_LOG_FACILITY_INFO
286  | #   define	DEF_FACILITY_INFO		WITH_LOG_FACILITY_INFO
287  | #else
288  | #   define	DEF_FACILITY_INFO		_stderr
289  | #endif
290  | 
291  | #ifdef	WITH_LOG_FACILITY_DEBUG
292  | #   define	DEF_FACILITY_DEBUG		WITH_LOG_FACILITY_DEBUG
293  | #else
294  | #   define	DEF_FACILITY_DEBUG		NULL
295  | #endif
296  | 
297  | #ifdef	WITH_LOG_FACILITY_TRACE
298  | #   define	DEF_FACILITY_TRACE		WITH_LOG_FACILITY_TRACE
299  | #else
300  | #   define	DEF_FACILITY_TRACE		NULL
301  | #endif
302  | 
303  | #ifdef	WITH_LOG_FACILITY_WARN
304  | #   define	DEF_FACILITY_WARN		WITH_LOG_FACILITY_WARN
305  | #else
306  | #   define	DEF_FACILITY_WARN		_stderr
307  | #endif
308  | 
309  | #ifdef	WITH_LOG_FACILITY_PROB
310  | #   define	DEF_FACILITY_PROB		WITH_LOG_FACILITY_PROB
311  | #else
312  | #   define	DEF_FACILITY_PROB		_stderr
313  | #endif
314  | 
315  | #ifdef	WITH_LOG_FACILITY_ERROR
316  | #   define	DEF_FACILITY_ERROR		WITH_LOG_FACILITY_ERROR
317  | #else

319  | #endif

321  | #ifdef	WITH_LOG_FACILITY_FATAL
322  | #   define	DEF_FACILITY_FATAL		WITH_LOG_FACILITY_FATAL

340  | #define      M_SWSTATE2	0x0008
341  | #define      M_SWSTATE3	0x0010
342  | #define      M_SWITCH	( M_SWSTATE1 | M_SWSTATE2 | M_SWSTATE3)
343  | #define      M_LOAD	0x0020
344  | #define      M_CLEAR	0x0040
345  | #define      M_PREPEND	0x0080
346  | #define      M_HELP	0x0100

419  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
420  | /**				      MACROS				     **/
421  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
422  | 
423  | /**
424  |  **  I'm going to remove all of the calls to free( ) since they are not
425  |  **    necessary for Modules.  Since the modulecmd program is only run for
426  |  **    a very short time ( usually <1sec) it's faster to not clutter the heap
427  |  **    by freeing up memory.
428  |  **
429  |  **  If you disagree with this decision, or have some problems with this
430  |  **    behavior on your system, configure with --enable-free
431  |  **
432  |  **  Note that all memory deallocations should go through null_free()
433  |  **/
434  | 
435  | #ifndef USE_FREE
436  | #  define  free( x)  
437  | #  define  FreeList( x, y)  
438  | #endif
439  | 
440  | /** 
441  |  **  Some systems don't define S_ISDIR and S_ISREG
442  |  **/
443  | 
444  | #ifdef HAVE_SYS_STAT_H
445  | #ifndef S_ISDIR
446  | #define S_ISDIR( m) (((m) & S_IFMT) == S_IFDIR)
447  | #endif
448  | #ifndef S_ISREG
449  | #define S_ISREG( m) (((m) & S_IFMT) == S_IFREG)
450  | #endif
451  | #endif
452  | 
453  | /**
454  |  **  Error logger
455  |  **/
456  | 
457  | #define	ErrorLogger	Module_Error
458  | #define	LOC		module_name, __LINE__
459  |
